title: MSPaint Talent
content:

Tutorials on how to shade like that would be epic... I realize the artist is using far more colors than Keen's limited 16, but the techniques involved are still relevant.

I thought it was cool, anyway.

title: PAINt
content:
That's brilliant stuff.

Paint is powerful, but its interface is too slow for my liking. Having to do everything with the mouse just irritates me--I need keyboard shortcuts and such in order to work effectively. Though I did create this a couple of years ago:
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/drawage/cliffplex.png[/img]

TGF's image editor appeals to me much more:
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/drawage/TGF-bucket.png[/img]

The right-click colour selection feature and convenient palette window are two of the nicest features, along with all the tools being listed along the left instead of hidden in menus. Not to mention I work better with a limited palette.

It's interesting how many people might say, "A Paint utility would be easy to make." Why are there none that can replace it? Unfortunately, those that attempt to end up getting dragged off on that 'photo-editing' waterslide and create something that's far less usable for pixel art.

Maybe I'm just too picky.

title: Re: PAINt
content: i like tgf image editor more than paint for the same reason as spleen[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: PAINt
content:
I feel pretty much the same way about Paint. It's awfully clunky for a program with so few features. If there were a program like it but with better palette management, alpha, hotkeys and possibly simple layers I would be thrilled. I just use the Gimp when I want to pixel (since it has all those things) but something more lightweight would be wonderful.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: PAINt
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]If there were a program like it but with better palette management, alpha, hotkeys and possibly simple layers I would be thrilled.[hr][/quote]
Like [url=http://www.humanbalance.net/gale/us/]GraphicsGale[/url]? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: PAINt
content:
The thing I like about Paint the most is probably the fact that you can stretch out the canvas simply by clicking the corner of the picture. No other program I've seen does that. You always have to go up to some sort of Canvas or Image menu, go to some sort of "Canvas Size" option, and put in some exact values.

Hmm, I'm gonna try out that GraphicsGale one.
Also try Pixel Editor. ([url=http://www.newfreedownloads.com/Multimedia-Graphics/Image-Editors/Pixel-Editor.html]I think this is it.[/url]) It's not really too spectacular, but I sometimes use it when paint is too limited. (Especially when I have a lot of images open, since it uses tabs rather than windows.)-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Paint
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Genius314: The thing I like about Paint the most is probably the fact that you can stretch out the canvas simply by clicking the corner of the picture.[hr][/quote]

That it's my favorite MSPaint feature too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] , it helped me a lot while using MSPaint for editing app icons. (I used an icon editor for adding transparency to imported BMPs from Paint, but all the pixel work was done in Paint.)
[hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

title: hmm...
content:
All the graphics in my Tantalus Wars are done in Paint --and for those who've seen my graphics on The Barracades, they aren't lacking in textures and shading.

MSPaint just needs time and precision, and you can get some extremely awesome stuff out of it.

title: uh?
content: You'll have to be more specific, dude... That Artrage program that was pointed out in the painting thread does a pseudo-3d finger-painting effect, where you can see brushstrokes and stuff.  Is that what you're after?
